storyInfo: Viviana kills Cora. Federico realizes that Arturia is playing at the top of the empresses' spire. Arturia extracts the 'Witch King's last words' from the minds of the witnesses to his death. The pocket dimension opens, and the Witch King's Spire returns.

attributes.content: The clouds above Zwillingstürme are... floating so freely.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Is this what you wanted to see at the end?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Ja.
attributes.name: 'Cora'

attributes.content: Your music helped me see. Incredible. Not through my eyes, but through my mind.
attributes.name: 'Cora'

attributes.content: I gave Viviana a few hints, as you wished.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: She wanted so much to have a real family, but... she didn't follow her strongest emotions.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Nein, my dear friend.
attributes.name: 'Cora'

attributes.content: It was her feelings for everyone that led to her decision to kill me.
attributes.name: 'Cora'

attributes.content: Are you satisfied?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Why wouldn't I be?
attributes.name: 'Cora'

attributes.content: I greeted death under the gaze of the one I loved.
attributes.name: 'Cora'

attributes.content: No need to mourn for me. This is the best end a sinner like me could hope for.
attributes.name: 'Cora'

attributes.content: Danke. Thanks to you, both Viviana and I will... go further.
attributes.name: 'Cora'

attributes.content: Your emotions will vanish into thin air before long.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: When the music ends, the strings may continue to vibrate for a while, but all sounds eventually fade into silence.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: No one can keep a cloud around, Arturia.
attributes.name: 'Cora'

attributes.content: The soul is frail. Even the most powerful emotions and the greatest desires will inevitably reach their respective ends.
attributes.name: 'Cora'

attributes.content: Even for the strongest of souls?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Is that not what you're here for?
attributes.name: 'Cora'

attributes.content: I'm leaving all my emotions and memories to you. Did you find what you were looking for?
attributes.name: 'Cora'

attributes.content: Yes, perhaps... I'll know soon.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Goodbye, Arturia.
attributes.name: 'Cora'

attributes.content: I hope you find your answer in melody.
attributes.name: 'Cora'

attributes.content: Cora Löwenstein, my gentle and stubborn friend... I was glad to have you on this journey.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I'll work to achieve the future we sought together.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You and I...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...Will meet again in melody.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Cora is... fading away?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Get away from her!
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Herr Reiner...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Cora...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: There's no need to explain.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: You made your decision... and put it to action.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: As for the rest...
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: This isn't the time to speak of it, for neither of us.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: The black flame took her. It was similar to what happened at Ludwigs-Universität.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: They were both Herkunftshorn's Arts, but not quite the same.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: The caster in that incident was an imitator who activated them by force, but this power feels almost like his own.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Red-black energy rumbles in the clouds.
It does not impatiently tear, swallow, and spread.
Instead it paces, watches and waits, on that throne in the clouds.
Do you see it?
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: The great Herkunftshorn has heeded our call and granted us an audience!
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: He has called forth the staircase leading to his eternal spire, the Genesis Horn!
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: The followers of the Witch King laugh.
They play the most piercing notes on their instruments, aiming them at their own chests and throats.
In response, the black clouds extend several tendrils towards them.
The dying cultists kiss the hand that their king has extended and become one with the black flame, ascending to become part of the dark cloud that now hovers above the Twin Spires.
The sky cracks with a dissonant roar.
Leithanien's greatest and most terrible sovereign, Herkunftshorn, issues his edict to his people.
...Herkunftshorn is really back.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: We have a problem.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Bound by the Arts inherent to the Movement, the people continue to play. But the altered Güldenesgesatz now only feeds Herkunftshorn's power.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: What did you just do?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Tried to shoot the cloud.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Now's not the time for this madness.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Madness? Not at all, Lessing. Do you know how long I've waited for this moment?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I was destined for this ever since his noise was forced into my head... No, since the day I was born.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You told me to fight, to face my responsibility and sins head-on. And you were completely right. Herkunftshorn is my sin, and it's my responsibility to face him.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I just need a way to drag him down from his palace in the clouds. Or... wherever he is.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Or I could send you up?
Wha—
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: An invisible thread catches him by the collar. It is light, gentle, and cool.
Suddenly, it constricts.
Argh—!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Who are you?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Rude to yell at someone who just saved your life, don't you think?
The black flame... it landed right where I was standing?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Listen to Lessing and stop shaking your wand at the clouds. He can be a little stiff, but he's more reliable than most.
That was awfully sudden, Ermengarde.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Were you expecting a schedule? A timetable? I rushed all the way back from Kazdel. Look how much wear and tear there is on my cube-thing.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: My hat got all dirty, too. Mind if I clean it with your horn?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: You're no fun.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Just... keep your hands off my horns. How bad is the situation?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Extremely.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: I don't even need witchcraft to tell you that much. This place is filled with threads that don't belong to it. It's so messy not even a Lich could clean it up. A little rain wouldn't solve anything.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Are you a Lich too?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Do I not look the part?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: I thought...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You thought Liches were all old men with long white beards, dressed in robes covering head to tail, with skeletal staves in their hands?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: ...I thought Liches would have more refined vocabularies.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: What happened to the old man?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: You know the first thing about him, don't you? Of course he went straight into that cloud.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: He strode back from the border of Leithanien the moment Herkunftshorn opened his eyes on the throne.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: And he pulled on all our threads, too. I'm sure even the Liches of Kazdel could hear his cursing.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: How many of you are here?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Everyone who could come.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Do you realize how inconvenient this is? It's like you were planning to move, and had loaded all your scrolls and talismans on the truck, then the very next day you hear that your old home is getting blown up.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: I mean, can't you Leithanians keep things together for even a single day without us?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: The Liches are back.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: ...This is a serious situation.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: The Genesis Horn is about to descend.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Grimmacht, your violin...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Good.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: We haven't played together in a while, Lieselotte.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Ja. The ensemble performance should be coming to a close, as is the custom. Then it's our turn.
attributes.name: Ewigegnade

attributes.content: Herkunftshorn... the calamity that Leithanien has always been destined to face.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: We already beat him once.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: We can do it again.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: It's the Kaiserinnen's melody.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Grimmacht and Ewigegnade have made their move.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Do what you need to, Viviana.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: ...We'll do our part as well.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Golden light floods out from the Gesatzswächter's sword and armor.
As the light engulfs him, the other Gesatzswächter respond to the empresses' melody.
Beams of Arts shoot towards the sky from every corner, drawing closer together and joining up.
The sky is covered in black, but an even brighter cloud rises from the ground.
Under the golden arch, the sound of an organ gently covers those beneath the Twin Spires, while the violin's passionate, soaring notes pierce the roiling clouds like a sword.
Dozens of hands weave thousands of threads, plucking at the melody in the sky and the wind, making them even clearer.
The Twin Empresses, the Gesatzswächter, and the Liches.
All the guardians of Leithanien stand together against its former king, now returning from the void.
The chaos grows.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Only the Kaiserinnen's melody can fight Herkunftshorn.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Melody?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Organ, violin... and cello.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I can't hear the cello.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It's a part of the noise. Not at all like ordinary music.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Your ears are accustomed to hearing music, but mine are equally receptive to all forms of sound.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The conclusion is clear.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Arturia has escaped from prison.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: (Piercing noise)
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'?

attributes.content: ...What is this? The falling black flame... it's standing up like a human?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Is it the work of Originium Arts, or...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The unfortunate truth is...
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: I probed them with witchcraft, and there are fragments of human emotion contained in the Arts energy within.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Are they still alive?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Of course not.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Even we, who deal with death on a daily basis, couldn't survive with neither a body or a soul.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: What we're seeing are merely shadows of their former lives. Or as the fanatics would put it, 'echoes.'
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: ...Good for them? I guess their dream came true.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It's not good news.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Normally, such echoes can only exist in... how do I put this... a space where flesh and blood cannot exist. Or anything else tangible.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Where there is no concept of life or death, no passage of time. The only thing that can survive there is information.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Under normal circumstances, 'echoes' are simply trails of information that exist only as a lingering illusion.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: But the emotions I felt in that black flame were flowing.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Get to the point.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: You're as impatient as a block of wood.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Fine, fine, you're not Liches. Long story short, reality is being encroached upon, and Herkunftshorn has really spruced up that little pocket dimension of his. His consciousness probably lives on within.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: So... you said you could send us up.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Absolutely.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: But are you sure about this? Like I said, no one's ever been inside, other than Herkunftshorn.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: If he can 'exist' there, why couldn't I? Might as well try.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ah, to be young and daring.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: After dealing with boring, depressed old folks and the mercenaries of Kazdel for so long, I forgot you Leithanians could be interesting.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Unfortunately, not even Liches have a way to send the living into that space.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Entering the Genesis Horn requires a stable connection between the two dimensions. It's like me calling out to my teacher, and him answering in response.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Could the bleating of these masked loonies actually wake him?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Absolutely not.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: The old man spent over a decade trying everything he could think of, from ancient Sarkaz witchcraft to the latest Leithanian Arts, all to no avail.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: He even tried bringing the temple of the Liches directly to Zwillingstürme, until the other masters came together to stop him.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Can you tell where the source of the problem is?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: It's right in front of us. The Twin Empresses' Spires.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Would you like me to Exile the Twin Spires along with everybody inside? I mean, I could. It's not even hard. I could Exile all of Zwillingstürme if you want.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: If that was a joke, it's not funny.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Fine. Then when it comes down to it, you won't be relying on us Liches to act, right?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Your Gesatzswächter have drawn the curtains. What would they do if the Genesis Horn goes out of control, to the point where even the Twin Empresses couldn't stop it?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: ...They'd destroy the Twin Spires, along with the entire amphitheater.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (Piercing noise)
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'?

attributes.content: Here it comes again.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: The remnants of the Witch King... They just won't leave me alone, even in death.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ermengarde and I will take care of matters here.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Go to the Twin Empresses Spires and find the path into the Genesis Horn.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Take this.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: What's this? A cloth knot? No mementos, please; I don't need them.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It's a communicator, not a memento.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: The Liches use threads to communicate with each other. I don't know Sarkaz witchcraft, so I have to rely on a physical object.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Pull the knot lightly, like this, and Ermengarde and I will receive the message.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: You'd better.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Don't worry, he'll be fine. Maybe a little mortally wounded, but I can fix that.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Now go and face what you need to, Ebenholz. Everything I need to protect is below.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Besides, someone needs to watch your back and keep your escape route open.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Alright, I'll try to come back alive.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I know you will.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: You too.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Who goes there?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: A Sankta... and an Imperial caster?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Hallo, my name is Viviana Droste.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The Imperial casters are all on the bridge below, fighting Herkunftshorn alongside the Kaiserinnen. I didn't expect to run into anyone on this floor.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...Operator Ebenholz.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Wait, you're also with Rhodes Island? Hah, what are the odds?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I am an executor of Laterano's Notarial Hall. We have a cleaning agreement with Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I was permitted to access some operator records while aboard the landship.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Rhodes Island...?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I have a few friends with a lot of history with that place.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Does that mean we're on the same side?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: (Piercing noise)
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'?

attributes.content: They've caught up.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Do you hear it?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Above, near the top...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Ja, it's getting clearer.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: A cello?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Yes. It is Arturia's music.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: A grayish rain falls on the balcony, flowing backwards before it can touch Arturia's strings and forming a cloud before her.
Or rather, a smoke ring.
I knew the Arts of those Caprinae couldn't stop my smoke ring.
And here I thought my first audience member would be my obsessed little brother.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Enough, little angel. No one wants to hear you play.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: I thought you wished to enter the Genesis Horn, Herr Fremont.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The Austere Authority, too... You all want to clean up Herkunftshorn's grim legacy, but deep down, you harbor other desires.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Grimmacht wants power. As for you... ah, such deeply etched emotions.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The Witch King's closest confidant, a clash of ideologies, and a joining of Arts... Your friendship was practically synonymous with Leithanien's golden age.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: And doesn't your parting of ways make this reunion of old friends all the more alluring?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: What are you babb—are you reading my mind?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Not even the King of Sarkaz dared browse my scrolls. Watch yourself if you doing so, angel.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: The music of your heart simply resonates with mine.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Just as my music reaches the ears of many, I can't choose not to hear the whispers of your heart.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: So that's your little trick.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Your music was the key. Herkunftshorn's true melody had nothing to do with that score he scribbled down!
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: 'The soul of the traitor will lead them to the lost Genesis Horn.'
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Seemann, Loris, Brandt, Gerhard... and Cora.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I found the Witch King's final words, buried in the depths of their emotions.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Good for you. You got to hear his dying ramblings.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Would you like a medal from Leithanien? You can take it and scram. Flutter on back to Laterano.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: A gray cloud appears beneath Arturia.
It explodes and engulfs the Sankta and her instrument.
Sorry, Herr Fremont.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I cannot stop.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I must see Herkunftshorn.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I want to play him. I want to feel the life he led, his thoughts in his last moments... and the intense emotions that still echo in the skies above Leithanien, long after his death.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I want an answer.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Your parlor tricks will only hasten your death, Sankta.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: I tried, Professor. I buried my head in the tomes of the spire, looking for an answer within their pages.
attributes.name: 'Gerhard'

attributes.content: Lives are so fragile. One wrong choice, and they're gone forever.
attributes.name: 'Gerhard'

attributes.content: But Herkunftshorn's will remains unwavering, even in death. Like an everlasting spire.
attributes.name: 'Gerhard'

attributes.content: What makes him so special?
attributes.name: 'Gerhard'

attributes.content: Can Herkunftshorn truly be killed?
attributes.name: 'Lieselotte'

attributes.content: His Arts are inside both me and Hildegard. We were weapons made to fight him. Was he ever truly mortal, if only something designed to defeat him can do so?
attributes.name: 'Lieselotte'

attributes.content: They say you told Herkunftshorn the secrets of eternity. Hiding behind a curtain not belonging to this land, he has avoided the gaze of death itself.
attributes.name: 'Lieselotte'

attributes.content: What is that dimension like?
attributes.name: 'Lieselotte'

attributes.content: The Liches have studied it for thousands of years.
attributes.name: 'Ermengarde'

attributes.content: But no one has ever entered it, other than Herkunftshorn. By doing so, he's learned more than any of us.
attributes.name: 'Ermengarde'

attributes.content: Are you not curious? Don't you want to steal the Genesis Horn and take it for the Liches?
attributes.name: 'Ermengarde'

attributes.content: We could bring back all of its knowledge. The Sarkaz could make use of it.
attributes.name: 'Ermengarde'

attributes.content: Risk? Since when do we need to listen to the Twins? Leithanien has never been our country.
attributes.name: 'Ermengarde'

attributes.content: The risk comes from the dimension itself.
attributes.name: 'Fremont'

attributes.content: The void... the endless... demons.
attributes.name: 'Fremont'

attributes.content: The void is far from empty.
attributes.name: 'Fremont'

attributes.content: It is filled with danger. The unknown.
attributes.name: 'Fremont'

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: 'Fremont'

attributes.content: Enough.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: ...What was that blackness just now?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Was it your last 'death,' Herr Fremont?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You... glimpsed into the void.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: It almost swallowed you.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I've heard that Liches can extend their lives almost indefinitely.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Then... do you still feel fear when facing the destruction of the flesh?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: You're talking about matters you do not and should not understand.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Why not?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Life is short. Why must we approach its conclusion knowing nothing?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The forbidden is forbidden for a reason.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: If you won't abandon your pursuit, then you'll have to die here.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Thousands of threads rain down from the void behind the Lich, faster than a gale and thicker than a deluge.
They wrap themselves around Arturia's cello, her bow and strings, as well as her hands and torso.
Exile.
The old Lich has no plans to allow her to return to Laterano. He wants her to disappear completely.
Arturia smiles. She draws her bow, perhaps for the last time.
Forgive me my ignorance and arrogance, Herr Fremont.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But I'd rather die the very next second, fall into the void, be lost to chaos...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Than stop playing.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The last note sounds.
Before she is swallowed by the infinite void, Arturia knows her performance is complete.
Do you see it, Ermengarde?
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: Thanks for the heads-up. There are so many threads here that my soul was almost shaken from my body before I could see clearly.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: That's the Genesis Horn.
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: It looks so much like the Witch King's legendary spire...
attributes.name: Lessing

attributes.content: The dark cloud cracks.
It is like a great eye, slowly opening up in the void.
Reflected within is none other than the dark spire last seen twenty-three years ago.
Right in between the Twin Spires, right where it used to be.
Was the Genesis Spire ever truly toppled?
Did Herkunftshorn, the Witch King, ever truly die?
Did every Leithanian's nightmare just return, or did it never leave?
The sound of the cello is gone?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...Arturia.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Herr Giallo!
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The knot is moving.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It's a warning from Lessing and the Lich.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: This place isn't normal. Extinguish your candle, Frau Droste... Don't use any Arts.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I have no idea what's going to happen next.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: The stairs... they've changed?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Is this some kind of Arts?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: An illusion created by Frau Giallo's music? Or something else?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Herr Ebenholz?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Only faint footsteps...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Soon, not even that.
The spiral staircase continues to extend further and further, until its end is no longer in sight.
Am I walking up, or down?
Viviana feels her consciousness grow distant.
All she knows for sure is that she is alone on these stairs.
